Bit/Byte

EXTRACT (FUN)
EXTRACT (FUN)
Â¶
FUNCTION EXTRACT : BOOL
Returns bit number
N
of value
X
Example in ST:
FLAG
:=
EXTRACT
(
X
:=
81
,
N
:=
4
);
(* Result : TRUE, because 81 is binary 1010001, so the bit '4' is 1 *)
FLAG
:=
EXTRACT
(
X
:=
33
,
N
:=
0
);
(* Result : TRUE, because 33 is binary 100001, so the bit '0' is 1 *)
InOut:
Scope
Name
Type
Comment
Return
EXTRACT
BOOL
The Nth bit of value
X
Input
X
DWORD
Input value
N
BYTE
Number of the bit to be extracted. Counting starts at 0.

rows: Number of the bit to be extracted. Counting starts at 0.
